info.description:
Amazon WorkSpaces Service

Amazon WorkSpaces enables you to provision virtual, cloud-based Microsoft Windows and Amazon Linux desktops for your users.
info.title: Amazon WorkSpaces

post.description: Associates the specified IP access control group with the specified directory.

Adds one or more rules to the specified IP access control group.

This action gives users permission to access their WorkSpaces from the CIDR address ranges specified in the rules.

Creates an IP access control group.

An IP access control group provides you with the ability to control the IP addresses from which users are allowed to access their WorkSpaces. To specify the CIDR address ranges, add rules to your IP access control group and then associate the group with your directory. You can add rules when you create the group or at any time using AuthorizeIpRules.

There is a default IP access control group associated with your directory. If you don't associate an IP access control group with your directory, the default group is used. The default group includes a default rule that allows users to access their WorkSpaces from anywhere. You cannot modify the default IP access control group for your directory.
Creates the specified tags for the specified WorkSpace.

Creates one or more WorkSpaces.

This operation is asynchronous and returns before the WorkSpaces are created.

Deletes the specified IP access control group.

You cannot delete an IP access control group that is associated with a directory.
Deletes the specified tags from the specified WorkSpace.
Deletes the specified image from your account. To delete an image, you must first delete any bundles that are associated with the image.
Retrieves a list that describes the configuration of bring your own license (BYOL) for the specified account.
Retrieves a list that describes modifications to the configuration of bring your own license (BYOL) for the specified account.
Retrieves a list that describes one or more specified Amazon WorkSpaces clients.
Describes one or more of your IP access control groups.
Describes the specified tags for the specified WorkSpace.

Retrieves a list that describes the available WorkSpace bundles.

You can filter the results using either bundle ID or owner, but not both.
Describes the available AWS Directory Service directories that are registered with Amazon WorkSpaces.
Retrieves a list that describes one or more specified images, if the image identifiers are provided. Otherwise, all images in the account are described.

Describes the specified WorkSpaces.

You can filter the results by using the bundle identifier, directory identifier, or owner, but you can specify only one filter at a time.
Describes the connection status of the specified WorkSpaces.
Disassociates the specified IP access control group from the specified directory.

Imports the specified Windows 7 or Windows 10 bring your own license (BYOL) image into Amazon WorkSpaces. The image must be an already licensed EC2 image that is in your AWS account, and you must own the image.

Retrieves a list of IP address ranges, specified as IPv4 CIDR blocks, that you can use for the network management interface when you enable bring your own license (BYOL).

The management network interface is connected to a secure Amazon WorkSpaces management network. It is used for interactive streaming of the WorkSpace desktop to Amazon WorkSpaces clients, and to allow Amazon WorkSpaces to manage the WorkSpace.
Modifies the configuration of bring your own license (BYOL) for the specified account.
Modifies the properties of the specified Amazon WorkSpaces client.
Modifies the specified WorkSpace properties.

Sets the state of the specified WorkSpace.

To maintain a WorkSpace without being interrupted, set the WorkSpace state to ADMIN_MAINTENANCE. WorkSpaces in this state do not respond to requests to reboot, stop, start, or rebuild. An AutoStop WorkSpace in this state is not stopped. Users can log into a WorkSpace in the ADMIN_MAINTENANCE state.

Reboots the specified WorkSpaces.

You cannot reboot a WorkSpace unless its state is AVAILABLE or UNHEALTHY.

This operation is asynchronous and returns before the WorkSpaces have rebooted.

Rebuilds the specified WorkSpace.

You cannot rebuild a WorkSpace unless its state is AVAILABLE, ERROR, or UNHEALTHY.

Rebuilding a WorkSpace is a potentially destructive action that can result in the loss of data. For more information, see Rebuild a WorkSpace.

This operation is asynchronous and returns before the WorkSpaces have been completely rebuilt.
Removes one or more rules from the specified IP access control group.

Starts the specified WorkSpaces.

You cannot start a WorkSpace unless it has a running mode of AutoStop and a state of STOPPED.

Stops the specified WorkSpaces.

You cannot stop a WorkSpace unless it has a running mode of AutoStop and a state of AVAILABLE, IMPAIRED, UNHEALTHY, or ERROR.

Terminates the specified WorkSpaces.

Terminating a WorkSpace is a permanent action and cannot be undone. The user's data is destroyed. If you need to archive any user data, contact Amazon Web Services before terminating the WorkSpace.

You can terminate a WorkSpace that is in any state except SUSPENDED.

This operation is asynchronous and returns before the WorkSpaces have been completely terminated.
Replaces the current rules of the specified IP access control group with the specified rules.

AccountModification.description: Describes a modification to the configuration of bring your own license (BYOL) for the specified account.

DedicatedTenancyManagementCidrRange.description: The IP address range, specified as an IPv4 CIDR block, for the management network interface used for the account.

DedicatedTenancySupport.description: The status of BYOL (whether BYOL is being enabled or disabled).

ErrorCode.description: The error code that is returned if the configuration of BYOL cannot be modified.

ErrorMessage.description: The text of the error message that is returned if the configuration of BYOL cannot be modified.

ModificationState.description: The state of the modification to the configuration of BYOL.

StartTime.description: The timestamp when the modification of the BYOL configuration was started.

GroupIds.description: The identifiers of one or more IP access control groups.

UserRules.description: The rules to add to the group.

ReconnectEnabled.description: Specifies whether users can cache their credentials on the Amazon WorkSpaces client. When enabled, users can choose to reconnect to their WorkSpaces without re-entering their credentials.

ClientPropertiesResult.description: Information about the Amazon WorkSpaces client.

ClientProperties.description: Information about the Amazon WorkSpaces client.

ResourceId.description: The resource identifier, in the form of a directory ID.

UserRules.description: The rules to add to the group.

ResourceId.description: The identifier of the WorkSpace. To find this ID, use DescribeWorkspaces.

Tags.description: The tags. Each WorkSpace can have a maximum of 50 tags.

Workspaces.description: The WorkSpaces to create. You can specify up to 25 WorkSpaces.

FailedRequests.description: Information about the WorkSpaces that could not be created.

PendingRequests.description:
Information about the WorkSpaces that were created.

Because this operation is asynchronous, the identifier returned is not immediately available for use with other operations. For example, if you call DescribeWorkspaces before the WorkSpace is created, the information returned can be incomplete.

DefaultWorkspaceCreationProperties.description: Describes the default values used to create a WorkSpace.

CustomSecurityGroupId.description: The identifier of any security groups to apply to WorkSpaces when they are created.

DefaultOu.description: The organizational unit (OU) in the directory for the WorkSpace machine accounts.

EnableInternetAccess.description: The public IP address to attach to all WorkSpaces that are created or rebuilt.

EnableWorkDocs.description: Specifies whether the directory is enabled for Amazon WorkDocs.

UserEnabledAsLocalAdministrator.description: Specifies whether the WorkSpace user is an administrator on the WorkSpace.

GroupId.description: The identifier of the IP access control group.

ResourceId.description: The identifier of the WorkSpace. To find this ID, use DescribeWorkspaces.

NextToken.description: If you received a NextToken from a previous call that was paginated, provide this token to receive the next set of results.

AccountModifications.description: The list of modifications to the configuration of BYOL.

NextToken.description: The token to use to retrieve the next set of results, or null if no more results are available.

DedicatedTenancyManagementCidrRange.description:
The IP address range, specified as an IPv4 CIDR block, used for the management network interface.

The management network interface is connected to a secure Amazon WorkSpaces management network. It is used for interactive streaming of the WorkSpace desktop to Amazon WorkSpaces clients, and to allow Amazon WorkSpaces to manage the WorkSpace.

DedicatedTenancySupport.description: The status of BYOL (whether BYOL is enabled or disabled).

ResourceIds.description: The resource identifiers, in the form of directory IDs.

ClientPropertiesList.description: Information about the specified Amazon WorkSpaces clients.

GroupIds.description: The identifiers of one or more IP access control groups.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of items to return.

NextToken.description: If you received a NextToken from a previous call that was paginated, provide this token to receive the next set of results.
The token to use to retrieve the next set of results, or null if no more results are available.

Result.description: Information about the IP access control groups.

ResourceId.description: The identifier of the WorkSpace. To find this ID, use DescribeWorkspaces.

BundleIds.description: The identifiers of the bundles. You cannot combine this parameter with any other filter.

NextToken.description: The token for the next set of results. (You received this token from a previous call.)

Owner.description:
The owner of the bundles. You cannot combine this parameter with any other filter.

Specify AMAZON to describe the bundles provided by AWS or null to describe the bundles that belong to your account.

NextToken.description: The token to use to retrieve the next set of results, or null if there are no more results available. This token is valid for one day and must be used within that time frame.

DirectoryIds.description: The identifiers of the directories. If the value is null, all directories are retrieved.

NextToken.description: If you received a NextToken from a previous call that was paginated, provide this token to receive the next set of results.
The token to use to retrieve the next set of results, or null if no more results are available.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of items to return.

NextToken.description: If you received a NextToken from a previous call that was paginated, provide this token to receive the next set of results.
The token to use to retrieve the next set of results, or null if no more results are available.
If you received a NextToken from a previous call that was paginated, provide this token to receive the next set of results.

WorkspaceIds.description: The identifiers of the WorkSpaces. You can specify up to 25 WorkSpaces.

NextToken.description: The token to use to retrieve the next set of results, or null if no more results are available.

WorkspacesConnectionStatus.description: Information about the connection status of the WorkSpace.

BundleId.description: The identifier of the bundle. All WorkSpaces that are created from this bundle are retrieved. You cannot combine this parameter with any other filter.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory. In addition, you can optionally specify a specific directory user (see UserName). You cannot combine this parameter with any other filter.

Limit.description: The maximum number of items to return.

NextToken.description: If you received a NextToken from a previous call that was paginated, provide this token to receive the next set of results.

UserName.description: The name of the directory user. You must specify this parameter with DirectoryId.

WorkspaceIds.description:
The identifiers of the WorkSpaces. You cannot combine this parameter with any other filter.

Because the CreateWorkspaces operation is asynchronous, the identifier it returns is not immediately available. If you immediately call DescribeWorkspaces with this identifier, no information is returned.

NextToken.description: The token to use to retrieve the next set of results, or null if no more results are available.

Workspaces.description:
Information about the WorkSpaces.

Because CreateWorkspaces is an asynchronous operation, some of the returned information could be incomplete.

GroupIds.description: The identifiers of one or more IP access control groups.

FailedCreateWorkspaceRequest.description: Describes a WorkSpace that cannot be created.

ErrorCode.description: The error code that is returned if the WorkSpace cannot be created.

ErrorMessage.description: The text of the error message that is returned if the WorkSpace cannot be created.

FailedWorkspaceChangeRequest.description: Describes a WorkSpace that could not be rebooted. (RebootWorkspaces), rebuilt (RebuildWorkspaces), terminated (TerminateWorkspaces), started (StartWorkspaces), or stopped (StopWorkspaces).

ErrorCode.description: The error code that is returned if the WorkSpace cannot be rebooted.

ErrorMessage.description: The text of the error message that is returned if the WorkSpace cannot be rebooted.

Ec2ImageId.description: The identifier of the EC2 image.

ImageDescription.description: The description of the WorkSpace image.

ImageName.description: The name of the WorkSpace image.

IngestionProcess.description: The ingestion process to be used when importing the image.

ImageId.description: The identifier of the WorkSpace image.

IpRuleItem.description: Describes a rule for an IP access control group.

ipRule.description: The IP address range, in CIDR notation.

ManagementCidrRangeConstraint.description: The IP address range to search. Specify an IP address range that is compatible with your network and in CIDR notation (that is, specify the range as an IPv4 CIDR block).

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of items to return.

NextToken.description: If you received a NextToken from a previous call that was paginated, provide this token to receive the next set of results.

ManagementCidrRanges.description: The list of available IP address ranges, specified as IPv4 CIDR blocks.

NextToken.description: The token to use to retrieve the next set of results, or null if no more results are available.

DedicatedTenancyManagementCidrRange.description: The IP address range, specified as an IPv4 CIDR block, for the management network interface. Specify an IP address range that is compatible with your network and in CIDR notation (that is, specify the range as an IPv4 CIDR block). The CIDR block size must be /16 (for example, 203.0.113.25/16). It must also be specified as available by the ListAvailableManagementCidrRanges operation.

ClientProperties.description: Information about the Amazon WorkSpaces client.

ResourceId.description: The resource identifiers, in the form of directory IDs.

OperatingSystem.description: The operating system that the image is running.

RebootRequest.description: Describes the information used to reboot a WorkSpace.

RebootWorkspaceRequests.description: The WorkSpaces to reboot. You can specify up to 25 WorkSpaces.

FailedRequests.description: Information about the WorkSpaces that could not be rebooted.

RebuildRequest.description: Describes the information used to rebuild a WorkSpace.

RebuildWorkspaceRequests.description: The WorkSpace to rebuild. You can specify a single WorkSpace.

FailedRequests.description: Information about the WorkSpace that could not be rebuilt.

UserRules.description: The rules to remove from the group.

RootStorage.description: Describes the root volume for a WorkSpace bundle.

Capacity.description: The size of the root volume.

StartRequest.description: Information used to start a WorkSpace.

StartWorkspaceRequests.description: The WorkSpaces to start. You can specify up to 25 WorkSpaces.

FailedRequests.description: Information about the WorkSpaces that could not be started.

StopRequest.description: Describes the information used to stop a WorkSpace.

StopWorkspaceRequests.description: The WorkSpaces to stop. You can specify up to 25 WorkSpaces.

FailedRequests.description: Information about the WorkSpaces that could not be stopped.

TerminateRequest.description: Describes the information used to terminate a WorkSpace.

TerminateWorkspaceRequests.description: The WorkSpaces to terminate. You can specify up to 25 WorkSpaces.

FailedRequests.description: Information about the WorkSpaces that could not be terminated.

UserStorage.description: Describes the user storage for a WorkSpace bundle.

Capacity.description: The size of the user storage.

BundleId.description: The identifier of the bundle used to create the WorkSpace.

ComputerName.description: The name of the WorkSpace, as seen by the operating system.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the AWS Directory Service directory for the WorkSpace.

ErrorCode.description: The error code that is returned if the WorkSpace cannot be created.

ErrorMessage.description: The text of the error message that is returned if the WorkSpace cannot be created.

IpAddress.description: The IP address of the WorkSpace.

ModificationStates.description: The modification states of the WorkSpace.

RootVolumeEncryptionEnabled.description: Indicates whether the data stored on the root volume is encrypted.

State.description: The operational state of the WorkSpace.

SubnetId.description: The identifier of the subnet for the WorkSpace.

UserVolumeEncryptionEnabled.description: Indicates whether the data stored on the user volume is encrypted.

VolumeEncryptionKey.description: The KMS key used to encrypt data stored on your WorkSpace.

ComputeType.description: The compute type. For more information, see Amazon WorkSpaces Bundles.

Owner.description: The owner of the bundle. This is the account identifier of the owner, or AMAZON if the bundle is provided by AWS.

RootStorage.description: The size of the root volume.

UserStorage.description: The size of the user storage.

WorkspaceConnectionStatus.description: Describes the connection status of a WorkSpace.

ConnectionState.description: The connection state of the WorkSpace. The connection state is unknown if the WorkSpace is stopped.

ConnectionStateCheckTimestamp.description: The timestamp of the connection status check.

LastKnownUserConnectionTimestamp.description: The timestamp of the last known user connection.

WorkspaceDirectory.description: Describes an AWS Directory Service directory that is used with Amazon WorkSpaces.

CustomerUserName.description: The user name for the service account.

DnsIpAddresses.description: The IP addresses of the DNS servers for the directory.

IamRoleId.description: The identifier of the IAM role. This is the role that allows Amazon WorkSpaces to make calls to other services, such as Amazon EC2, on your behalf.

RegistrationCode.description: The registration code for the directory. This is the code that users enter in their Amazon WorkSpaces client application to connect to the directory.

State.description: The state of the directory's registration with Amazon WorkSpaces

SubnetIds.description: The identifiers of the subnets used with the directory.

WorkspaceCreationProperties.description: The default creation properties for all WorkSpaces in the directory.

WorkspaceSecurityGroupId.description: The identifier of the security group that is assigned to new WorkSpaces.

ipGroupIds.description: The identifiers of the IP access control groups associated with the directory.

ErrorCode.description: The error code that is returned for the image.

ErrorMessage.description: The text of the error message that is returned for the image.

OperatingSystem.description: The operating system that the image is running.

RequiredTenancy.description: Specifies whether the image is running on dedicated hardware. When bring your own license (BYOL) is enabled, this value is set to DEDICATED.

ComputeTypeName.description: The compute type. For more information, see Amazon WorkSpaces Bundles.

RootVolumeSizeGib.description: The size of the root volume.

RunningMode.description: The running mode. For more information, see Manage the WorkSpace Running Mode.

RunningModeAutoStopTimeoutInMinutes.description: The time after a user logs off when WorkSpaces are automatically stopped. Configured in 60 minute intervals.

UserVolumeSizeGib.description: The size of the user storage.

WorkspaceRequest.description: Describes the information used to create a WorkSpace.

BundleId.description: The identifier of the bundle for the WorkSpace. You can use DescribeWorkspaceBundles to list the available bundles.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the AWS Directory Service directory for the WorkSpace. You can use DescribeWorkspaceDirectories to list the available directories.

RootVolumeEncryptionEnabled.description: Indicates whether the data stored on the root volume is encrypted.

UserName.description: The username of the user for the WorkSpace. This username must exist in the AWS Directory Service directory for the WorkSpace.

UserVolumeEncryptionEnabled.description: Indicates whether the data stored on the user volume is encrypted.

VolumeEncryptionKey.description: The KMS key used to encrypt data stored on your WorkSpace.

WorkspacesIpGroup.description: Describes an IP access control group.
